comment: Decent lab professor, She's very clear about what she wants and very forgiving on certain things. Probably wouldn't want to take her in lecture though. As for the labs itself, she just explains what to do in the beginning of class and then lets you do your thing. If you have any questions, she will happily help and she grades pretty forgiving.

Professor Denton is a great lab professor. I never really got the "she can come off as rude" but I also rarely asked her questions. When I did she was happy to help. Before each lab she goes over things you need to know to navigate smoothly through the lab and if you haven't learned the material in your lecture beforehand she will help you learn.

it might seem like she comes off as rude or mean, but i think its just chemistry labs with the lab notebook and the report sheets that arent enjoyable. shes so cute and will help you if you need it, just respect her and she'll respect you

great professor. she can come off a bit rude at times but she means well. it seems like she cares about her students and if you show that you care, she'll make sure to help you out. lots of work but she's great!
She is very nice, but is initmidating to appraoch
Fun class to take. She's understandable and allows you to work at your own pace which is nice. She's very helpful if you have questions. Her grading is tough however.

As long as you attend lab and do the worksheets/quizzes, you should do well. She does in-lab lectures about concepts that will make understanding them much easier. Allows missing a lab if you give fair notice. Feedback is very helpful - she will let you know if something is wrong in your work and why. Drops a few low grades by default too!

Professor Denton is very friendly. She seemed intimidating at first, but she is easy to talk to and she learns everyone's names. She's happy to answer questions and she doesn't grade too harshly. The only thing is that there is a lot of homework, but it's going to be the same in every 1211L class. The final was also pretty easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lovely professor who really cares about the students. The lab reports are simple, grading criteria is clear, and before every lab, she thoroughly explains the concepts and math. She takes time to demonstrate the lab as well, and is very helpful when answering questions. She's a wonderful and knowledgeable professor, can't recommend her enough!!!

Professor Denton is a great lab professor. She cares about her students and will even sacrifice her time if you make a mistake on a lab so you can do it correctly. Just make sure not to horseplay with the lab equipment or miss lab dates. As long as you meet the lab requirements and do well on the lab final, you should be getting at least a B grade.

She was a great lab professor. She made sure we all knew what we were doing, and she answered questions perfectly. She also corrected our labs before giving them back, which was very helpful when studying for the final. The pre-lab write ups took a long time, but that was just the course not the professor.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The prelab write-up, lab reports, and prelab quizzes took me about 4 hours a week, but they weren't hard, just annoying to do. She gives assistance in the lab whenever it's asked for willingly. Her demonstrations were also clear and all the labs were easy.

I had her for lab, however she is still a very good instructor. She is rather blunt but not in a rude way, and she will straight up tell you if a calculation is wrong or something when checking your lab notebook so you won't get a bad grade on the actual submission. She also will give you a make up lab if you miss for a good reason.

She is just so sweet and will help anyone in a heartbeat. She tried to get to know everyone and will help you with the lab, the math, and will even stay late. She can be particular about rounding/grades. She checks pre-labs during class instead of at the end so DO THEM. Btw every lab class has the exact same work, quizzes, final, and grading scale.

I thought professor Denton was a great. She made the class fun and interesting which made me really enjoy her class. You do have to do a pre lab in your personal notebook before every lab and take a quiz the night before. She does let you turn in the lab report when you show up to class the next week instead of at the end of class which is great.

pre-lab quizzes can be a little tough, but Dr. Ann is very fair. she drops a few grades, so she is also very forgiving. she's intimidating at first but if you show effort in the class, she will help you out a BUNCH. She helped me out on a lab report at 10PM once, really appreciated that. She is very kind to those who visibly care about doing well.

Very chill professor. She gives mini lessons before class and explains procedure in depth. Her pre lab quizzes can be a pain sometimes but the actual course content is rather easy. She can come off as rude but is actually kind to those who show effort. She expects you to come to class prepared with your lab notebook.

She may come off a little harsh but is very kind if you show ANY effort. She gives very informative mini-lessons prior to each lab that are often easier to follow than actual chem lectures. She's also great at explaining what is expected. Show some effort and you will be rewarded. She is much more competent than most other lab instructors at KSU.

Mrs. Denton is pretty amazing! She gets down to business and is ready to go once you enter the classroom. She is an amazing help if you need more clarification on certain things. She is extremely lovely and welcoming. I would recommend her for Chem 1212 lab!

I was a bit scared coming into this class because she didn't have many reviews but I think she is a solid choice for a chem lab professor. She will help you through the lab submissions and gives basically all the math with examples. Do NOT do the lab submissions last minute!! The final is tough but not made by her.

I came into this class kind of scared because of reviews and the fact that it's a lab for chemistry. This teacher is actually wayyy better than my actual chem lecture teacher. I basically rely on her to learn chem since she gives a brief overview of the stuff we need to know and actually helps us learn - you know what teachers are supposed to do.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great Professor!!! She so sweet helped me through my labs everytime I got lost but she helps and listens to you! Always willing to help!

She made chem lab very enjoyable online. Always responded to emails ASAP (scary fast sometimes) and gave leeway to those who had technology issues along the way. Grading was fair and there was only one assignment due a week. Very charismatic and enthusiastic about chemistry and enjoyed helping people who didn't understand what was happening.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She didn't really answer any emails, but she was pretty kind in class. Just make sure you put in some effort with your lab notebook and youll be fine.

I'm gonna get to the point. Not accessible outside of class, lets you know about class or assignment changes the day of with no advance, if your class is split she puts one at a disadvantage, let's lab flow make grading errors and doesn't care to change them. She is a nice woman but not a good teacher. Lab quiz every week, with no idea whats on it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She was a great lab instructor! I went to her during office hours, and she was always happy to help. Chem 2 Lab is just hard in general, but she really cares about her students and helping them.

She is very sweet and very funny. Her lab is extremely easy and she is an easy grader. She answers questions extremely well and will walk you through problems/concepts you may not understand. She makes herself available after class so she is easy to get in touch with. She drops the lowest two quiz grades and the lowest lab grade. Final was easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Ms Denton is so lovely! I have taken her for both Chem 1211 and 1212 lab and she's been such a great lab professor. She always stays after class to help you with anything you might be having trouble with. She is super caring and wants you to succeed. Chem lab can be very long and tedious but she makes it tolerable. Love her!

Just no. Cares more about sigfigs than the actual content itself. Everytime I came to class, I got an hour-long repeat of what my lecture just taught. Got an A in lecture but a B in this class for no reason.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She will answer your questions, if you need help. Just know it will take some time for her to realize she needs to dub it down to where you can understand it. Grades very harshly. Work must be accurate and correct. Lastly, not a professor you take online. Take her in person, so that you can ask her things face to face.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: If needed she will spend 30 minutes explaining the math if people are still confused. She answers your questions straight forward and will even check your notebook to make sure your data looks right. She is a reasonable grader, just do the work and youll get an A. Drops lowest quiz and lab grade for us.

I had her for chem1212 lab and she is very nice! I recommend staying after your lab has finished so that way you can ask her questions. She also provides office hours, which can be very helpful. Furthermore, she always ensures that no one is confused in the class and will not mind questions if you are confused! She also posts PPTs for labs!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Expects you to teach yourself. Any work you give her must be entirely correct, or she'll take off a lot of points. And I mean A LOT of points. She will penalize you for the smallest things. If you ask her to explain something, she will not break it down to the point to where you understand. To sum it up, take her if you want a unbeatable challenge.
The pop quizzes are difficult. The labs are manageable. But Denton is one of those teachers that loves to grade just to take points off. She rarely responds to emails as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I took her lab and she's a nice professor, but her class is terrible and unorganized. She does answer questions and try's to help but she expects you to basically teach yourself the material. Like others are saying she is a brutal grader. Take her if you are strong in Chem & Science.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Took her for Chem 1211. I don't know what her standards are, but she grades work harshly. Compared my work with a fellow student, who received an A on an assignment. However, I got a C on it. In all, one of those old school professors, seeking to make you retake a class, you don't need to take again. A waste of class credit and money if you ask me.

As a professor, she will answer your questions, and emails. Bad news is that she grades like a 2 year old. She grades papers like I should be an expert at this stuff. Seriously, in a manner of two weeks, she brought my grade of a B+ to a C+. Still waiting on final grades, but her grading criteria is ridiculous. She provides no feedback on grades.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Denton is a great lab professor. She describes the content and the lab before performing the labs. She is very willing to answer any questions about lab procedures or calculations.
a VERY tough grader. she never responds to emails.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She will make this lab feel like a 4000 level 6 credit course. Quizes EVERY CLASS. She Even took labs online after classes were closed due to coronavirus. So we are basically learning nothing but still have to do all the work. Take her if you want to fail
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: OK, i'll go straight to the point, so that if you see a 4.0 or 5.0, you won't say, "hey, that seems like a good professor." She grades entirely too hard. Since day one, my information on my assignments have been detailed. I mean I have gone above and beyond, only to find F's and C's in grade book. Note: I am a A and B student, just think about it
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Mrs Denton is very nice. She makes sure students understand material presented in lab taking into account the different lecture schedules around the labs. She is a fair grader, always responds to emails, and is available for office hours. Workload is fair and the final was not surprising.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She is pretty lenient about grading lab notebook, having the lab manual out in class, and just everything in lab. does a good job explaining the lab before hand so often times you get out of lab in under an hour and a half if not earlier. lab sucks but she makes it easy .
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Denton is great at explaining chemistry which is quite hard to find at KSU. She gives 4 tests and drops one. She is very approachable and accesible out of the classroom. I failed the first two test but came back and aced the rest. I have to say that I think the only reason I got a B in the class was because I always attended SI sessions!

At chem lab, the professor doesn't really matter but she explains what you do today before the lab. If you ask her how to do it she will answer and check your experiment. She also curves some points in final exam! The syllabus is as same as chem 1. A lot things to do and the materials were really annoying. Good luck!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: She's one of the few professors i've had who's okay with explaining things more than once. She is super reasonable and always willing to help. She's super specific about sig figs but that's not so bad. She responds quickly on email and is always willing to answer questions in class. Best lab professor i've had so far. Would take again.

Denton is a pretty chill lab professor. Her lectures can be boring at times but she is great at helping students during the lab and answering questions about the lab and the reports. She will also make sure you know what your mistakes are before you leave the lab. As long as you do the work and look over it you should make an A. Would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Denton is awesome. Her pre lab lectures are pretty boring, but you can tell she's passionate about chemistry. She grades the lab reports easily and is very understanding. It's an easy A as long as you pay attention during pre lab lectures as she tells you verbatim how to do the report. She's really nice, take her!

Mrs. Denton is very approachable. You could show up to class without the report completed and ask questions before submitting. She would host math tutorials at the end of lab for the math heavy labs, in hopes that people would understand and do the report correctly. She is a little ditsy, but that is hilarious to me, so I enjoyed it.

Professor Denton is passionate about Chemistry. She can be a little all over the place, but most of the time will catch herself. She is willing to answer questions. She is big on correct sig figs. You can miss one lab, but attendance is important. She just skims over your notebook to make sure you did the write-up, but isn't too strict on that.

She is one of my favorite teachers. She was helpful and explained a lot of what I needed for my lecture class. She explains labs really well and when I wrote the wrong lab on accident she just printed the correct one out and didn't make me do the notebook write up for it! Very helpful with math as well.

She was seriously so helpful!! Worked on labs with class after we finished the experiment explaining the material. I learned more from her than lecture. When she talked in front of the class very scatter brained. said incorrect things but caught herself and took her a while to explain it, but she was so helpful it didn't matter.

I had her for lab and she was great. I was really nervous about this class when I signed up but it ended up being WAY better than I expected. She is there to answer any questions and is really helpful. Just watch out for your sigfigs on your lab sheets and you will do fine! Seriously she's great !

Chem 1212L. She's okay, does her best to make you understand the material. My biggest peeve was her slow responses to emails and not having ideal office hours. Had to go to other profs for questions. She was slow to getting started in 8am lab, but who isn't? I would recommend taking her.

Chem 1211L. Prof. Denton is super helpful and really nice! I really enjoyed her for a lab teacher. The lab was also very easy, I made an A, but that did come with effort! She can be a tough grader, so make sure to recheck your work for the correct number of sig figs. She's very strict on that. Overall, great teacher! I recommend her!

Chem 1211L. Very helpful teacher! Must attend class because it is a lab. Is always willing to help you succeed! Highly recommend Mrs. Denton. She makes sure before lab that you know exactly what to do. Will definitely take again. Grades labs fairly.
CHEM 1211L. She is a pretty good teacher. Just do your work and ask for help where you need it. She's very understanding and patient.
Professor Denton is very helpful during and after lab. She grades pretty easy. Loved her for Chem 1211 Lab

I had her for CHEM 1211 lab. She is nice and will explain things if you need help. When doing lab write-ups, make sure to use correct sig-figs because she counts off for that. Overall very easy class, but the final is challenging. Don't be afraid to take her.

Mrs. Denton is a really fair teacher. She explains each lab before hand & as long as you complete the lab for next class, she takes it pretty easy on your grades. Attendance is mandatory but you're able to leave as soon as you're finished. I recommend.

Ms.Denton is a wonderful lab professor. She is always really helpful during lab. Before lab she will go over the procedure and she is not very strict about lab attire. She is also a really fair grader as long as you always use proper significant figures. I am going to try to take her for the rest of my labs!
She reads off of PowerPoint slides directly and we never use the textbook. Do not take this class if you want to learn chemistry.

She isn't very clear at all and she's very hard to understand. She reads word for word off of her power points, so you basically have to teach yourself. We never use the book in class and only take notes off of her power points.

She is a terrible teacher! I took AP Chem is high school and it was the only thing that saved me in this class. Lectures are extremely confusing. Classes are not "mandatory," but you get zeros on homework or quizzes if you aren't there to turn them in. Never take Ann Denton. If there is no other section available, wait until another semester.

Can be confusing. But, she is always available for outside help and is very happy to help. If you dont take initiative then dont expect to do well. But if you do work hard, you will realize than her tests really are not all that hard. My recommendation would be to take a different prof if available, but a good grade is still possible if you try.

Prof. Denton is not a bad professor. She is very smart and knows her stuff. She is a bit scatter brained and gets words and molecules mixed up...and sometimes makes up her own. Overall i would take her again since she offers extra credit and with a little initiative its easy to ace her class.

Very unclear in lectures. Very smart but CANNOT relate the material to the class. Seems to only confuse students more than they already were. Not very organized & makes too many mistakes during lecture. Unfortunately she has put me to sleep with the way she lectures. Not a good way to keep your grade up in her class.

She cannot teach and explain the material clearly. You should not hope that you can understand the material that she teaches. You should read the book and cover the material by yourself. She is very inconsistent and makes a lot of mistakes while teaching (eg. substraction, addition, information, etc)
